title: @KateyKhaos
body:
Why is Vandal Jax purple ingame and his splash art is white qq.

That's the whole reason I bought that skin, is the impression it was White ingame.
:(

replies.body:
His splash looks light blue to me, personally. 

If you're curious what skins looks like in game, SkinSpotlights on YouTube covers all skins with in-game coverage, so you can see what you're getting before you buy it. :]

How come there isn't some sort of "model preview" button or some direct link to the spotlight video from within the store itself? Like at a corner somewhere of every skin, there should be a button that somehow gives the player a glimpse of how it looks in-game and maybe even a list of changes the skin provides.

Honestly I don't think it's needed, videos and pictures easy to find.  Riot has been posting pictures on the LoL website when skins are coming out.  I'm sure there are many websites that also cover skin releases with links to vids and pics.

I know some people probably thing that the LoL client should be a 1 stop shop, and I agree to some extent, but when the community does such a good job at covering these things I don't care that Riot doesn't have anything in place for it.
I imagine those links would be as problematic as the lore links that they're trying to figure out.

This is not a replacement for getting it professionally tested with a primary care physician or optometrist, but it could be helpful.
